00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00083 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00084 
00085 typedef struct {
00086     volatile unsigned long lock;
00087 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00088     const char *file;
00089     const char *function;
00090     unsigned line;
00091     int cpu;
00092 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00093 } xnlock_t;
00094 
00095 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00096 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00097 #else
00098 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00099         0,                                      \
00100         NULL,                                   \
00101         0,                                      \
00102         -1                                      \
00103         }
00104 #endif    
00105 
00106 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00107 
00108 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00109 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00110 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00111 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00112     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00113 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00114 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00115 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00116 
00117 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00118 
00119     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00120 }
00121 
00122 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00123 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00124 
00125 static inline spl_t
00126 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00127 {
00128     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00129 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00130 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00131 {
00132 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00133     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00134     unsigned long flags;
00135 
00136     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00137 
00138     adeos_load_cpuid();
00139 
00140     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00141         {
00142         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00143             {
00144             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00145 
00146 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00147             if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00148                 {
00149                 adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00150                 printk(KERN_ERR
00151                        "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00152                        "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00153                        "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00154                        lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00155                        lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00156                 show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00157                 for (;;)
00158                     safe_halt();
00159                 }
00160 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00161             }
00162 
00163 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00164         lock->file = file;
00165         lock->function = function;
00166         lock->line = line;
00167         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00168 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00169         }
00170     else
00171         flags |= 2;
00172 
00173     return flags;
00174 }
00175 
00176 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00177 
00178 {
00179     if (!(flags & 2))
00180         {
00181         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00182 
00183         rthal_cli();
00184 
00185         adeos_load_cpuid();
00186 
00187         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00188             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00189         }
00190 
00191     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00192 }
00193 
00194 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00195 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00196 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00197 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00198 
00199 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00200 
00201 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00202 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00203 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00204 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00205 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00206 
00207 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00208 
00209 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00210 
00211 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00212 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00213 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00214 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00215    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00216    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00217    timer interrupt instead. */
00218 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00219 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00220 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00221 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00222 /* Using 3/4 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00223    experimentation that proved to fit on tested x86 platforms with
00224    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00225    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00226    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00227 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 3 / 4)
00228

00230 #define XNARCH_ROOT_STACKSZ   0 /* Only a placeholder -- no stack */

00268 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00269 
00270     /* Kernel mode side */
00271     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00272     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00273     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00274     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00275     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00276 
00277     /* User mode side */
00278     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00279     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00280 
00281     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00282     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00283     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00284 
00285 } xnarchtcb_t;
00286

00303 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00304     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00305 }
00306 
00307 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00308     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00309 }
00310 
00311 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00312     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00313 }
00314 
00315 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00316     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00317 }
00318 
00319 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00320     return adeos_processor_id();
00321 }

00325 #define xnarch_put_cpu(flags) adeos_put_cpu(flags)

00327 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00328 do { \
00329     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00330     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00331     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00332     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00333 } while(0)

00338 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00339 
00340 {
00341     spl_t s;
00342     splhigh(s);
00343     splexit(!!imask);
00344     return !!s;
00345 }

00349 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00350                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00351                                                    void *cookie),
00352                                    void *cookie)
00353 {
00354     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00355 
00356     if (!err)
00357         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00358 
00359     return err;
00360 }
00361 
00362 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00363 
00364     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00365 }
00366 
00367 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00368 
00369 {
00370     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00371         return -EINVAL;
00372 
00373     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00374 
00375     return 0;
00376 }
00377 
00378 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00379 
00380 {
00381     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00382         return -EINVAL;
00383 
00384     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00385 
00386     return 0;
00387 }

00390     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00391 }
00392 
00393 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00394     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00395 }
00396 
00397 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00398 
00399     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00400 }

00411 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);

00414 
00415 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00416 
00417 {
00418 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00419     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00420 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00421     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00422        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00423        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00424        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00425        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00426        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00427     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00428 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00429 }
00430 
00431 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00432                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00433     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00434 }
00435 
00436 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00437 
00438 {
00439     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00440 
00441     adeos_load_cpuid();
00442 
00443     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00444        and always inside a critical section. */
00445     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00446     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00447     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00448     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00449     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00450 }
00451 
00452 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00453     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00454 }
00455 
00456 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00457                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00458                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00459                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00460                                     )
00461 {
00462 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00463 
00464     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00465         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00466         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00467         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00468         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00469         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00470         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00471         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00472         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00473         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00474         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00475         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00476         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00477         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00478         "ret\n\t" \
00479 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00480         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00481         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00482       : /* no output */ \
00483       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00484         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00485         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00486         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00487         "b" (out_tcb), \
00488         "S" (in_tcb), \
00489         "a" (outproc), \
00490         "d" (inproc));
00491 
00492 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00493 
00494     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00495     
00496     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00497         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00498         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00499         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00500         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00501         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00502         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00503         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00504         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00505         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00506         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00507         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00508         "ret\n\t" \
00509 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00510       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00511         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00512         "=S" (esi_out), \
00513         "=D" (edi_out), \
00514         "+a" (outproc), \
00515         "+d" (inproc) \
00516       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00517         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00518         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00519         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00520 
00521 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00522 }
00523 
00524 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00525                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00526 {
00527     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00528     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00529 
00530     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00531         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00532            bit need to be cleared. */
00533         clts();
00534     
00535     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00536 
00537     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00538         {
00539         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00540 
00541         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00542 
00543         if (!inproc->mm)
00544             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00545         }
00546 
00547     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00548 
00549     stts();
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00553                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00554     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00555 }
00556 
00557 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00558     /* Empty */
00559 }
00560 
00561 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00562 
00563 {
00564 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00565 
00566     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00567         {
00568         clts();
00569 
00570         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00571             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00572         else
00573             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00574         }
00575 
00576 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00577 }
00578 
00579 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00580 
00581 {
00582 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00583     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00584 
00585     if (task)
00586         {
00587         if (!task->used_math)
00588             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00589 
00590         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00591            hardware. */
00592         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00593         }
00594 
00595     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00596        user-space or kernel thread. */
00597 
00598     clts();
00599 
00600     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00601         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00602     else
00603         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00604 
00605 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00606 }
00607 
00608 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00609                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00610                                          const char *name)
00611 {
00612     tcb->user_task = current;
00613     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00614     tcb->esp = 0;
00615     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00616     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00617     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00618 }
00619 
00620 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00621 
00622     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00623     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00624     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00625     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00626     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00627     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00628 }
00629 
00630 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00631                                                int imask,
00632                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00633                                                void *cookie)
00634 {
00635     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00636     stts();
00637     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00638     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00639     entry(cookie);
00640     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00644                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00645                                        void *cookie,
00646                                        int imask,
00647                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00648                                        char *name)
00649 {
00650     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00651 
00652     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00653     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00654     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00655     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00656     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00657     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00658     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00659     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00660     *--(*psp) = 0;
00661 }
00662 
00663 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00664 
00665 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00666 
00667 {
00668     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00669        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00670 
00671     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00672 
00673     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00674         {
00675         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00676         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00677         }
00678 }
00679 
00680 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00681 
00682 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00683 }
00684 
00685 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00686 
00687 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00688 
00689     while (!*flagp)
00690         {
00691         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00692         schedule_timeout(1);
00693         }
00694 }
00695 
00696 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP

00698 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00699 
00700     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00701 }
00702 
00703 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00704 
00705 {
00706     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00707                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00708                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00709                                      NULL,
00710                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00711 }
00712 
00713 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00714 
00715 {
00716     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00717                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00718                                      NULL,
00719                                      NULL,
00720                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00721 }
00722 
00723 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00724 
00725 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00726 {
00727     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00728 }
00729 
00730 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00731     
00732 {
00733     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00734     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00735     unsigned long flags;
00736     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00737 
00738     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00739 
00740     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00741        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00742        context. */
00743     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00744                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00745 
00746     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00747     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00748     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00749     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00750 
00751     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00752         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00753     
00754     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00755                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00756 }
00757 
00758 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00759 
00760 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00761 
00762     return 0;
00763 }
00764 
00765 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00766 
00767     return 0;
00768 }
00769 
00770 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00771 
00772     return 0;
00773 }
00774 
00775 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00776 
00777 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00778 
00779 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00780 
00781 {
00782 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00783     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00784        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00785     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00786 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00787     xnshadow_release_events();
00788     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00789     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00790     schedule_timeout(50);
00791     xnarch_release_ipi();
00792 }
00793 
00794 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00795 
00796 {
00797     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00798 
00799     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00800         {
00801         spl_t s;
00802         splsync(s);
00803         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00804         splexit(s);
00805         return 1;
00806         }
00807 
00808     return 0;
00809 }
00810 
00811 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00812 
00813     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00814 }
00815 
00816 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00817 
00818     kfree(chunk);
00819 }
00820 
00821 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00822     
00823     xnshadow_grab_events();
00824 }

00826 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00828 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00829 
00830 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00831                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00832                                            const char *name)
00833 {
00834     struct task_struct *task = current;
00835 
00836     tcb->user_task = task;
00837     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00838     tcb->esp = 0;
00839     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00840     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00841     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00842 }
00843 
00844 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00845 
00846 {
00847     unsigned irq;
00848 
00849     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00850         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00851                              handler,
00852                              NULL,
00853                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00854 }
00855 
00856 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00857 
00858 {
00859     unsigned irq;
00860 
00861     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00862         {
00863         switch (irq)
00864             {
00865 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00866             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00867             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00868             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00869             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00870 
00871                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00872                 continue;
00873 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00874 
00875             default:
00876 
00877                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00878             }
00879         }
00880 }
00881 
00882 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00883 
00884 {
00885     unsigned irq;
00886 
00887     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00888         {
00889         switch (irq)
00890             {
00891 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00892             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00893             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00894             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00895             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00896 
00897                 continue;
00898 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00899 
00900             default:
00901 
00902                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00903             }
00904         }
00905 }
00906 
00907 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00909 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00910 
00911 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00912     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00913        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00914        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00915     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00916 }
00917 
00918 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00919     rthal_release_timer();
00920 }
00921 
00922 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00923 
00924 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00925 
00926 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00927 
00928 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00929 
00930 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00931 
00932 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00933 
00934 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00935 {
00936     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00937 
00938     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00939     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00940     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00941 
00942     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00943 }
00944 
00945 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00946 
00947 {
00948     int err;
00949 
00950 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00951     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00952        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00953     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00954 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00955 
00956     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00957 
00958     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00959         return -ENOSYS;
00960 
00961     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00962                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00963                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00964                               NULL,
00965                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00966 
00967     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00968 
00969     err = xnshadow_init();
00970 
00971     if (err)
00972         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00973 
00974     return err;
00975 }
00976 
00977 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00978 
00979     xnshadow_cleanup();
00980     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00981     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00982 }
00983 
00984 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00985

00990 
00991 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00992 
00993 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
00994 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
00995 
00996 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00997 
00998 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
00999 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01000 
01001 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01002 
01003 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)

01005 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
